block.p: Doris Wan Chen, the daughter of Teresa Chen and Dr. Patrick Chen of Chesterfield, Mo., was married yesterday to Terence Macken Zahner, a son of Loretta and Ernest Zahner of Glen Cove, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel Ulloa, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony in St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University in Manhattan.
The couple, both 25, graduated from Cornell University, where they met.

Doris Wan Chen, the daughter of Teresa Chen and Dr. Patrick Chen of Chesterfield, Mo., was married yesterday to Terence Macken Zahner, a son of Loretta and Ernest Zahner of Glen Cove, N.Y. The Rev. Daniel Ulloa, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony in St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University in Manhattan.
The couple, both 25, graduated from Cornell University, where they met.

Mrs. Zahner recently received a master's degree in human cognition and learning from Teachers College at Columbia University, where she is now a candidate for a Ph.D. in that subject. Her father, a materials scientist, is a consultant to medical device manufacturers in Chesterfield. Her mother owns the Gely Company, a knitwear manufacturer in St. Louis.

Mr. Zahner works in Manhattan as an assistant treasurer in foreign exchange operations at Commerzbank, a German commercial bank. His mother, now retired, taught the fourth grade at Public School 156 in Laurelton, Queens. His father retired as a professor of biology from Queensborough Community College in Bayside.
